title: Angry Andy
description: Andy and Erin return to Dunder Mifflin, only to discover that Nellie has taken his job and office and refuses to give them up. Meanwhile, Ryan becomes jealous after Pam tries to play matchmaker for Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Whoo! Wow, it is raining cats and dogs out there. Holy moley.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Phyllis says the same twelve clichés every time it rains. So, I promised everyone that if she says them all by noon today, I will send out for hot chocolates.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So how was the drive in?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, nobody knows how to drive in the rain.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You don't say?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah. You know the roads are actually the slickest in the first half hour?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, the plants are gonna love this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I actually sleep better when it's raining.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Tell me about it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Time's almost up. How many are left?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just one. "This weather makes me want to stay at home, curled up with a good book."

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Phyllis. This rain... does it make you wanna be doing something?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, like aren't some things just so nice and cozy in the rain?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Lots of things are cozy in the rain.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that's noon. Exactly. [others groan]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I mean, normally the rain would make me want to stay home, curled up with a good book. But everybody's being so nice to me today.  I'm really happy being here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] My girlfriend's back and there's gonna be trouble-

quotes.speaker: {Andy} & {Erin}
quotes.text: Hey la, hey la...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...my girlfriend's back!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [simultaneously] ...his girlfriend's back! [others cheer and applaud]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anyway, I know it's the end of the day. We just wanted to stop by and say hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Welcome home.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nice sweater.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [wearing a Cornell sweater] Thank you. Nellie was nice enough to give it to me. She's sweet. I just wish there was pockets.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What happened to old salty?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nellie let me bobble-ize him. His name is now Captain Mutato.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've written quite a bit of X-Men fan fiction. Captain Mutato is half man, half mermaid. So he can fight crime as a man and make love as a mermaid. Most of my writing involves the latter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okey dokey. [knocks on door]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa. Well, you must be the famous Nellie Bertram I've been hearing all about. I am the famous Andy Bernard you've been hearing all about.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just want to thank you for jumping in and minding the store during my temporary absence.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You are most welcome.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anyway, now that I'm back, I would love to have my office back, whenever you get a chance.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Obviously, we'll figure out the, uh, logistics of moving all this stuff out of here. But, you know, the sooner the better.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get back to normalcy.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Hmm, no.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.text: ...and then just lay him in his crib, and then bicycle his legs. And then after Jim quiets down, you do the same thing with your baby. [Pam, Jim and Kelly laugh] But if he keeps having problems, just give me a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh, thank you so much. But seriously, we don't want to bother you any more than we already have.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's no bother, you guys are our friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ravi, our amazing pediatrician, was asking us if we knew any girls and I said I know the perfect girl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep. Because Kelly is Indian and... oh, that's it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Race had nothing to do with it. I just knew they'd be good together.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [talks over flashbacks] Kelly has been a handful in the past.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [cries, slams fist on desk] Why?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Ryan and Kelly make out in the nook] But she's had a bad influence. She's like an addict. [Ryan and Kelly argue] And I just had to get her clean.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Ryan and Kelly make out on Oscar's desk] Get lower.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, also, little tip, never shake the baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry, just to be clear, you're saying do NOT shake the baby.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don't shake the baby. Um, a lot of times, parents get frustrated 'cause the baby's crying and they shake the baby. And you got to, um, you can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't shake our baby?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. I'd never heard that before. So, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm glad you said something.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Me too.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly and I broke up and she can do whatever she wants. And her new boyfriend seems awesome, if you're into Indian people. I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, um, what's the deal with this guy? He's really into Kelly, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, they're really great together.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Maybe we weren't right together, but... it's weird. I'd rather she be alone than with somebody. Is that love?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's about it, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Nellie! You've been terrific in your interim capacity. But, Andrew is the rightful manager so if you would just give him his office-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is what I was trying to tell you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'm not accustomed to people saying no to me. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, Bobby, get accustomed to it because then it feels so good when they finally say yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You're both adults. I'm sure you can figure this out between yourselves.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I never allow sexual desire to influence a business decision. So I find it best to excuse myself temporarily until I've had a chance to make love and then go back and analyze the situation rationally. Buffett operates the same way.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm gonna count down from five and if you are not out of my office, I'm going to dock your pay one hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [chuckling] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Five... four...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can't dock my pay-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Angela! Dock Andy's pay one hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: On it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great. Five, four, three, two, one. Angela, please dock Nellie's pay a hundred dollars. Angela?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Do you want to go again?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Let's go again. Five... four...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ooh, she's counting again.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Three... two... one...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, oh!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Angela, two hundred dollars!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Seriously, Angela?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I got a little bit of an anger problem. Got me in some trouble a couple years ago.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: When I see him start to get mad, I just put my hand on his arm like this.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I know what, let's go... ten thousand dollars! [Andy laughs] Five... four...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're just saying numbers. It's meaningless.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Three...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's literally like-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Two... [Andy runs out of the room] one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There you go. [helps Andy in the car] Hey. we're gonna have a nice, hot date.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey. So last night was so not a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I was just tired.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We both were. Plus, I was definitely not my normal sexy self.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa. No. Are you kidding? You were so sexy. Just the thought of you last night, like, crazy turns me on. It just didn't last night.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really. It's not a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I know it's not... a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I found this the other day while I was journaling and they reminded me of you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, those are from our weekend at the time share.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, the fractional ownership property. [sigh] Oh, we took this one right before we got in that huge fight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: God I don't even remember what that fight was about.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You were being really bratty about where we would go out to dinner. But all I remember is how pretty you looked, taking those pictures of me. Anyway, if you want to order prints of your own, I can send you the link.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm in love with Kelly Kapoor. And I don't know how I'm gonna feel tomorrow or the next day or the day after that, but I do know that right here, right now, all I can think about is spending the rest of my life with her. Again, that could change.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: When you lost the manager job-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Did it affect you outside of the office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know what the technical term is... Penial softiosis?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erin, I am so glad that you trusted me. You came to the exact right person for this. No, I have never once experienced anything remotely like that. Never.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Washington Monument.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eiffel Tower.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I saw you were getting along with Ryan again.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: He's so sweet. He pointed to my latte and he said, "Kelly, that will be the color of our children."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he's so great. Remember how it felt when he cheated on you though?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Which time?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am not going to let Kelly throw her life away on Ryan. And it has nothing to do with access to my pediatrician. Why you would even ask or were going to ask, because I- I felt like that question was coming.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One of Toby's eyes is getting smaller. So there's that. Gabe bragged about having an extra ticket to the air show this weekend and Meredith said she was interested and then Gabe said immediately that his friend might be taking the ticket. So I'll keep you posted on that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Every day I brief Nellie on what's going on in the office. Most of it's irrelevant. But a good informer doesn't judge what's worth passing on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, and Andy lost his masculinity, so congratulations on that.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erin made it clear to me that he was unable to perform sexually last night. By contrast, I went to sleep with an erection so large it was like I was wearing no blanket at all. Wow, I knew you'd win, but you just demolished him! I'm a little bit jealous, actually. Reduced him to a mere ant.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I just wanted to take the man's job, not his manhood.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Okay, I would like to invite everyone into the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can't call a meeting. [laughs] But I would like to have a meeting in the conference room right now! So let's get in the conference room. Thank you. Good. Thank you for coming to my meeting.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Okay, if you would like to take a seat we can get started.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh! Can't do it 'cause I gotta run a meeting. So.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wanted to talk to all of you guys about [reads whiteboard] importance... and know that each and every one of you is vitally important.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew, not everyone here is important. And the word is "impotence."

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Which is important in its own way. So if you'd just like to take a seat, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: "Take a man's job, but leave him his balls." Margaret Thatcher said that... probably. Don't know. Don't read. Didn't see the movie.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: This meeting is not about any one person in particular. It is a human problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not just a human problem. Flounders frequently experience impotence, especially when converting from male to female and then back again to male.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nellie, does the person affected by this want us to help her in any way in particular?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, oh, it's not me. No, no. I've never had any problem in that arena. And I have been with several older men.

quotes.speaker: {Robert} & {Creed}
quotes.text: [in unison] How old?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Jinx. Buy me some Coke.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight told me about it earlier.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You promised!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dwight couldn't get it up for Nellie?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no, It's not me. I'm gonna prove it right here and now. [thrusts his pelvis]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop that! Dwight! Stop that, stop it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine, it was me. I couldn't- I had a problem with Erin last night. Happy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I had a lot on my mind last night. And I didn't perform. Okay? It happens to plenty of guys. It's usually not followed by a giant workplace discussion and an interview.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Every guy in this room has been touched by this affliction. Tuna? T-dog?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh... I have other issues. I'm terrible at math. Overweight. You- you're in great shape. A lot better shape than I am, tell you what.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It seems Andy is the only one with this problem. Fascinating.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fascinating.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't really see what the problem is. Erin doesn't even like sex, remember? You said it feels like getting tackled by a skeleton.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Chumbo, come on, help me out. Any problems with Little Chumbo?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Tip-top shape.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh... Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No. Um-um.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Creed, you are a thousand years old.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Haven't heard any complaints. Wouldn't care if I did.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, so I-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually Andy, I think maybe we experienced it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That a couple of times-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Couple of times.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Jim, maybe you could tell us about one of those times.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah Jim.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah Jim, get it out there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um... I don't... Uh, yes, that time that it was very late. Uh, we'd had sex so many times already, I was exhausted...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, stop.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was very drunk.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: If it makes you feel any better, I never had an orgasm until I was forty-two. And then when I did, it lasted 'til I was forty-four.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Forty-three was ju- I got nothing done. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I've read- and I don't know anything about this personally- but they say prostate stimulation can help.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: This is just, uh- This American Life, I think I heard it on.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, that's absolutely the case.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, my rectal electro-ejaculator is rated for bovine use only but I could let you rent it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, why don't you tell us about the best erection of your life? Or does anyone else have any remarkable erections they'd like to share? [Creed, Kevin and Meredith raise their hands]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, ooh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, what are we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Toby, doesn't HR have some rules against talking about this kind of stuff?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Erin, HR is a joke. I can't do anything about anything.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The most important thing to remember is not to stress about this. Stress just makes it worse, and then you stress more. And that's a vicious spiral.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I almost didn't come in today. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on the phone] Dad, don't think of it as a demotion. Just think of it as a promotion to a lower level. I don't think you have to tell your friends anything. It hasn't been decided yet.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Erin, on phone memos you're writing the date American style. Month, day, year. I prefer it day, month, year. Small, bigger, biggest. Oh, sexual innuendo. Not intentional.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Shut up. Shut up! I am sick of your dumb opinions. And if you don't like the way that I take phone messages, here! [throws phone] Take 'em yourself!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, and another thing! Our sex life is none of your businesses!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And Andy is the manager, not Nellie!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stop protecting me! I'm a man- I can protect myself! This is misdirected anger and I'm sorry! I don't mean to lash out at you! There's a lot coming up right now, all at once! [into phone] Dad go to hell, I'm taller than you!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Okay, just calm down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You are not the manager. I earned that job. I was personally chosen after Robert was chosen and quit.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, why don't you just take a seat?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why don't you take a seat, you idiot? [throws chair]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And why don't you take all your stupid memos and your stupid pens and your dumb caramels?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And your stupid face! [grabs Nellie's photo off the wall and smashes it on the ground] And your stupid office! [punches hole in the wall] Ah!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: He does not like that wall.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Maybe we'll get sent to anger management together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That would actually be cool. I'd love for you to meet some of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, Erin, you can join us now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, I hear you been bad-mouthing me to Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All I did was remind her that you used to treat her badly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well that's your opinion and it's her opinion, but it's not my opinion. If you have something bad to say to me, Pam, say it to my face.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Fair enough. Um... I don't think you're a very good person. And forgive me, but I feel like I've said this to you before: I don't like you very much.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well a lot of people would say that I'm a better match for Kelly than Ravi is.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh come on, Ryan. Really? Ravi's way better.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: For Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. Man, you're insane right now. Ravi's the whole package.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I've never met Ravi personally, but I'm gonna go ahead and say, just having knowing you a short while, Brian, that I prefer Ravi. And again, I've never even met the guy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, I wrote you the most amazing love poem. But I can't even read it. My heart couldn't handle it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Read it, please. I love amazing poetry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. It would cause me too much pain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Read through the pain. Be strong.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This poem would crush you!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ryan, go away! She found herself a beautiful boyfriend!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, man, he's absolutely gorgeous! Please leave her alone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You see, Kelly? Our love scares them. It screws up their cookie-cutter world.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ravi makes me incredibly happy. And Ryan puts me through so much drama. So I guess I just have to decide which of those is more important to me.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, we're going to go with Nellie as manager and put you back on the sales team. I promise you, in time, we'll all laugh about this incident. I already think it's kind of funny. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm saying no.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well you can't say no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sees Ryan on the horse] Oh, boo! Boo! Boo to you! Boo!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You are toxic! You are toxic!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Boo!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, hey. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, I have a few things to say to you, so please don't interrupt.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I wasn't going to interrupt.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well you do a lot, so just don't. Thank you. I know that I haven't always treated you the way that you, for whatever reason, feel you deserve to be treated. But I want to marry you, Kelly Kapoor. Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but someday, and probably.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Barf! Ugh, you suck!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What is your problem? [to horse wrangler] Hey, hey, hey, can we turn this back around quickly, please? This is very important to me.

quotes.speaker: Wrangler
quotes.text: Turn around. Turn around. Turn around!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can we turn this [bleep]-ing thing around? Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Wrangler
quotes.text: She don't wanna turn around.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you. Kelly, I can't promise you that we'll always stay together. I can't promise you that I'll never cheat on you. Nor should I. Modern marriages aren't built that way. Men aren't built that way. There's a very interesting article I can email to you. But I can tell you this. Even if the odds are fifty-fifty that we'll break up within the week, I wanna roll those dice. I love you, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Will you roll those dice with me?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You mean so much to me. But, I love Ravi and I choose him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No you don't.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No you don't.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I hope we can still be friends. Can I have a hug?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What? [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That was really cool. [they make out]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ugh. Eww!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it's good to see Kelly's maturing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Look, Andrew, we can discuss the specifics of the job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It's the apology. I really have to insist.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [British accent] No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Stop saying no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew, if you say no one more time, you're fired. So... is there anything else you wanna say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't describe it. I just, for the first time in a long time, I actually feel in control. I feel... alive.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Here- [grabs the box Andy's holding]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah- da, da, da, da. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But you hurt your hand.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I... Got... It.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Right now?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're not the least bit curious to hear a poem straight from Ryan's soul?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not at all, can we go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: "Kapoor and ka-desperate, he watches."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Second line.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: "He is a drifter out to sea."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "And when the Indian Ocean calms, one speck of white remains in waters cold and Kelly green."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's just so dumb. [chokes up] But when he describes himself as a child, lost on the life raft...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Ryan can never know.
